text.0: i invocate your son of strength the youthful with hymns the youngest god whose speech is guileless.
text.1: sage who sends wealth comprising every treasure bringer of many boons devoid of malice.
text.2: at eve and morn thy pious servants bring thee their precious gifts o priest of many aspects.
text.3: on whom the purifier all things living as on firm ground their happiness have stablished.
text.4: thou from of old hast dwelt among these people by mental power the charioteer of blessings.
text.5: hence sendest thou o sapient jātavedas to him who serves thee treasures in succession.
text.6: agni whoever secretly attacks us the neighbour thou with mitras might who harms us.
text.7: burn him with thine own steers for ever youthful burning with burning heat thou fiercest burner.
text.8: he who serves thee with sacrifice and fuel with hymn o son of strength and chanted praises.
text.9: shines out immortal in the midst of mortals a sage with wealth with splendour and with glory.
text.10: do this o agni when we urge thee quickly triumphant in thy might subdue our foemen.
text.11: when thou art praised with words and decked with brightness accept this chanted hymn the singers worship.
text.12: help us that we may gain this wish o agni gain riches wealthy one with store of heroes.
text.13: desiring strength from thee may we be strengthened and win eternal thine eternal glory.
